Service Details: - Provides services that include the Child Care Resource and Referral Program- Outreach program with drop-in programs, community development and presentations on Subsidy and Child Care- Mutual Aid program, providing low-cost and accessible training for child care providers and early childhood development professionals, consultation and support visits to child care providers/centres- Information and Referral that provides parents with child care referral options, child care information and consultations, and child care subsidy application assistance- Recruitment for Registered Licence not Required (RLNR), which supports Family Child Care Providers working to become Licenced with Child Care Licensing- Self-help programs that include the Toy and Resource Lending Libraries for parents, child care providers, and community partners, guidance and support choosing developmentally appropriate toys and activities for children aged 0-12 years- Offers Public-access computer
Cost: Many of our services are provided at no cost
